{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3162310,"name":"Pranav Ramnath","username":"pranav","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/a4c791/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-11T19:44:13.190Z","cooked":"

Hello!

I was just driving our robot when I saw it just stop. I still had communications and my joysticks were working. I went to check the CAN and I saw these LED patterns on the drivetrain Spark Maxes: video

This weird blink was there on all the drivetrain motors and I’ve never seen this until now. I also haven’t made major changes to my code. Any ideas?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-03-11T19:44:13.190Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":13,"reads":104,"readers_count":103,"score":90.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":429853,"topic_slug":"weird-spark-max-led-patterns","display_username":"Pranav Ramnath","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://drive.google.com/file/d/15FUNMejptpqaWR_y9O4aVdipPBAWshbh/view?usp=drivesdk","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":42}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54054,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 4926 Programming"},"post_url":"/t/weird-spark-max-led-patterns/429853/1","custom_user_title":"Team 4926 Programming","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3162314,"name":"Catbert","username":"catbert","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/catbert/{size}/178385_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-11T19:56:57.720Z","cooked":"

Oh good, it wasn’t just us. We have the same issue a while back. I believe it was either an ID issue or it needed to be updated. Make sure all the Sparks are assigned an ID and have the most recent update. FYI: if the ID’s don’t save in the Hardware Client, try assigning it in the Spark Max Client, that was more reliable.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-03-11T19:56:57.720Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":98,"readers_count":97,"score":39.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":429853,"topic_slug":"weird-spark-max-led-patterns","display_username":"Catbert","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55060,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/weird-spark-max-led-patterns/429853/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3162323,"name":"Pranav Ramnath","username":"pranav","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/a4c791/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-11T20:17:17.717Z","cooked":"

Thanks! I tried this but that issue is still there. I’m thinking there’s something wrong with my wiring.

I saw a similar pattern today on a robot where CAN was completely disconnected.

Interesting. The whole CAN shows up on my REV Hardware Client and the network is continuous. I’ll check if the CAN is disconnected anywhere.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-03-11T20:31:57.027Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":78,"readers_count":77,"score":15.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":429853,"topic_slug":"weird-spark-max-led-patterns","display_username":"Pranav Ramnath","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":65,"username":"Joe_Ross","name":"Joe Ross","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joe_ross/{size}/37_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54054,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 4926 Programming"},"post_url":"/t/weird-spark-max-led-patterns/429853/5","custom_user_title":"Team 4926 Programming","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3162336,"name":"Omer Huly","username":"Omer_Huly","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/omer_huly/{size}/8295_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-11T20:46:04.301Z","cooked":"

I saw this pattern once and it was weird. We assign a different ID to each Sparkmax and update all of them. Then, we went over all the CAN connection and checked that everything is wired correctly. It seemed that some wire was connected but not properly. After rewiring it, everything worked.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-03-11T20:46:04.301Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":72,"readers_count":71,"score":34.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":429853,"topic_slug":"weird-spark-max-led-patterns","display_username":"Omer Huly","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25356,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1690 Programming Mentor, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/weird-spark-max-led-patterns/429853/6","custom_user_title":"1690 Programming Mentor, CSA","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3162344,"name":"Pranav Ramnath","username":"pranav","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/a4c791/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-11T20:57:29.323Z","cooked":"

That’s what we’re planning on doing. Meet tomorrow, wire robot in one go, and drive (and hope for no problems!).

Thanks for the reply!

PS: Will update all of you here after I finish wiring.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-03-11T20:58:43.722Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":66,"readers_count":65,"score":13.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":429853,"topic_slug":"weird-spark-max-led-patterns","display_username":"Pranav Ramnath","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":25356,"username":"Omer_Huly","name":"Omer Huly","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/omer_huly/{size}/8295_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54054,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 4926 Programming"},"post_url":"/t/weird-spark-max-led-patterns/429853/7","custom_user_title":"Team 4926 Programming","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3162384,"name":"dyanoshak","username":"dyanoshak","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dyanoshak/{size}/65422_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-11T21:50:22.074Z","cooked":"
pranav:

I saw these LED patterns on the drivetrain Spark Max

This is very likely a problem with the CAN wiring. Either a flipped CANH and CANL somewhere on the bus or loose/intermittent connection somewhere.

Just saw the same behavior on my team and hour ago. While moving wires to troubleshoot it “fixed itself.” We found a connector that had one of the pins partially pushed out.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-03-11T21:50:44.004Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":55,"readers_count":54,"score":31.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":429853,"topic_slug":"weird-spark-max-led-patterns","display_username":"dyanoshak","primary_group_name":"REV","flair_name":"REV","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/d/b/db93216ec14c273ae2ca04aa396186c0461d0620.png","flair_bg_color":"F05A28","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":55,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"REV Robotics","title_is_group":false,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9020,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/weird-spark-max-led-patterns/429853/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3162392,"name":"Pranav Ramnath","username":"pranav","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/a4c791/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-11T22:09:25.800Z","cooked":"
dyanoshak:

This is very likely a problem with the CAN wiring.

Agreed!

i never had this problem but looking at the led patterns my guess is that a can connection is loose somewhere so the signal is inconsistent, i’m not sure though

Everyone in this thread suggested one thing - CAN wiring. Our team also knew that this was the problem and after a lot of moving-wires-around and redoing connections, this problem went away.
